Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2009 04:08AM tamlyn110 wrote:  Hi All, Hope everyone is doing well it is officially September "Our Month". I am getter more & more scared. I ended up with a really bad toothache and had to go to dentist today. I need a root canal done. I don't know if my chemo will get postponed now or not. They need medical release from the onc. to do the root canal, so now I am just waiting in pain. It seems like it is always something.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2009 01:13AM tamlyn110 wrote: Hi Delaine,   I was not allowed to do any exercises until I went to see him this past wednesday. He told me a few to do and I do them when I think about it (yea, I know). I was told I needed to get a port- no option. I still have a bruise on my arm from when they took blood the day of my surgery 2&1/2 weeks ago. Keep us updated.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2009 12:04AM tamlyn110 wrote: Hi All, Thanks for thinking of me. I got the port and I was in what they called twilight sleep. I was out! As soon as they were done I was wide awake. I did not have any pain until last night then I was in ALOT of pain. It felt like my shoulder muscle was ripped in half. I could not move my arm at all. I took pain pills and slept on & off all night. I feel alot better today, just a little sore. Not allowed to take off dressing for 3 days & no shower for 3 days.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2009 05:07AM tamlyn110 wrote: Mrsb45- I had my port out in Last monday (8/24). I was sore the first couple of days but It has gotten better. The only bad thing now is it is right where my bra strap is so it is a little sore when My strap rubs against it. I am not looking forward to chemo, I start 9/9/09 but at the same time I want to get started and get it over with. It is nice reading the descriptions of what others are going through so I know what to expect. We can all get through this together. It is nice knowing I am not alone, that someone else is going through the same thing I am (unfortuneatly).
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2009 07:01PM - edited Aug 23, 2009 01:13AM by tamlyn110 Hi all,   I will be starting chemo on 9/9. I am having my port put in on Monday. I am not looking forward to it at all. I am actually quite scared. I will have a/c x4 and taxol once a week for 12 weeks. I had my bilateral masectomy with TE's on 8/5. I am still uncomfortable from that. The "IRON BRA" term fits perfectly for me. I feel so tight across the chest ad back that I don't know if I will be able to handle it until exchange which is now going to be a lot longer than first anticipated due to having to have Rads after chemo. Hopefully we will all handle it well and not have any problems. I look forward to keeping in touch with you all.
Posts.Title: Starting chemo September 2009 krcll sanaisa

Posts.Content: tamlyn110 wrote: I had my bi-lat masectomy in aug, 2009 and had lymph nodes removed under right arm. My Dr. never told me anything about not having blood pressure taken or not having blood drawn in that arm, nothing! I read about it all on this site. While I was in the hospital recovering they were taking my blood pressure in that arm. I don't have lymhedema now and I hope I never get it but I am upset that I was never told about things to help prevent it. Tammy Dx 6/29/2009, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, 15/21 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My Surgeon never told me tamlyn110 PauldingMom

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2010 02:14AM tamlyn110 wrote: Notself- Not lift anything over 5 lbs for several months? Wow, I did'nt abide by that. I am really glad I did not go back to work when my BS said I could return if I wanted. My job is constant lifting of 15-30lbs. I am suppossed to return after all my treatment. Ruthbru- I don't really dwell on it. I am a little nervous everytime I get a twinge or pain in that arm. I just don't understand why I was'nt informed of the possibility of getting it or how to try to prevent it. This is something that you could develop even years after having lymph nodes removed so I think telling patients about precautions to take is'nt to much to ask for.

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2010 06:26PM tamlyn110 wrote: I am with you on the whole body image thing. I have been so depressed because I have gained 20 lbs., being bald and not having any energy/strengh to do anything. I just finished 6 months of chemo last week and start radiation next month. I just went back to work last week and it really wears me out. I am not me anymore and it sucks! I am worried everyday that it might come back and my onc. said no scans unless symptoms so that scares me even more. How do I know what to look for without worrying about every little thing. Everybody thinks I should be so happy since I am done with chemo now and I am but I still have radiation.... I am not done yet. The one thing that really gets me is everybody knows someonebody who has/had breast cancer and I have  to hear all about, even the ones who passed away. that really %&^**^$ me off.
